intro: Platystele lycopodioides, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed clubmoss, is a small, epiphytic plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Huperoniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and tiny, scale-like leaves. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are clustered in small, cone-like structures called strobila. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on trees or rocks in the understory of forests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
